intro: Derris henryi, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its roots contain toxic alkaloids, which have been used traditionally for their medicinal and pesticidal properties. Derris henryi is also valued for its role in soil nitrogen fixation due to its symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
